TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed CroppedBitmap extends System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource implements class System.ComponentModel.ISupportInitialize
Public NotInheritable Class CroppedBitmap Inherits BitmapSource Implements ISupportInitialize
type CroppedBitmap = class inherit BitmapSource interface ISupportInitialize

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap> implements the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISupportInitialize> interface to optimize initialization on multiple properties. Property changes can occur only during object initialization. Call <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap.BeginInit%2A> to signal that initialization has begun and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap.EndInit%2A> to signal that initialization has completed. After initialization, property changes are ignored.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap> objects created by using the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap.%23ctor%28System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource%2CSystem.Windows.Int32Rect%29> constructor are automatically initialized, and properties cannot be changed.
Metadata tags related to image data must be updated if an image is saved to a file after a transform is applied.
Use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap.SourceRect%2A> property of this class to define the area of the bitmap that is to be cropped.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap> implements the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISupportInitialize> interface to optimize initialization on multiple properties. To initialize a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap> created using this constructor, you must perform property initialization between <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap.BeginInit%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.CroppedBitmap.EndInit%2A> calls.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the rectangular area that the bitmap is cropped to.
Docs.value: The rectangular area that the bitmap is cropped to. The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks A with a set to will render the entire image. A rectangle that is not fully within the bounds of the bitmap will not render. ## Dependency Property Information ||| |-|-| |Identifier field|| |Metadata properties set to `true`|None|
